group.title: Birth
group.description: The emergence of a baby or other young from the body of its mother and the start of life as a physically separate being.

field.help: A young human being below the age of puberty or below the legal age of majority. The role of a person in relation to his/her parents.
field.title: Child

field.help: a woman in relation to a child or children to whom she has given birth, or adopted. The family role of a woman in relation to her child or children
field.title: Mother

field.help: A man in relation to his child or children. The family role of a man in relation to his child or children
field.title: Father

group.title: Death
group.description: The activity of dying or being killed; the end of the life of a person or organism.

field.help: A person who is recently dead.
field.title: Deceased

group.title: Displacement
group.description: The enforced departure of people from their homes, typically because of war, persecution, or natural disaster.

group.title: Emmigration
group.description: The activity of leaving one's own country to settle permanently in another; moving abroad.

group.title: Exile
group.description: The state of being barred from one's native country, typically for political or punitive reasons.

field.help: a person who lives away from their native country, either from choice or compulsion.
field.title: ExiledPerson

group.title: Immigration
group.description: The activity of of coming to live permanently in a foreign country.

field.help: A person who comes to live permanently in a country that is not the person's native country.
field.title: Immigrant

group.title: Residence
group.description: The activity of living in a particular place.

field.help: A person who lives somewhere permanently or on a long-term basis.
field.title: Resident

group.title: Travel
group.description: The activity of making a journey, typically of some length.

field.help: A person who is travelling or who often travels.
field.title: Traveller

group.title: Visit
group.description: The activity of going to see a person or place as a guest, tourist, etc.

field.help: The role of a person visiting someone or somewhere, especially socially or as a tourist.
field.title: Visitor

group.title: UniversityMatriculation
group.description: The formal process of entering a university or of becoming eligible to enter by fulfilling certain academic requirements.

field.help: A person who has matriculated or been registered on a list or roll, usually at a school.
field.title: Matriculant

field.help:
An official list or record of names of people who have participated in the activity of matriculation at a university, the formal process of entering a university or of becoming eligible to enter by fulfilling certain academic requirements.
source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matriculation
field.title: MatriculationRegister

field.help: An item written or printed in a diary, list, account book, or reference book.
field.title: Entry

field.help: A person who is studying at a university or other place of higher education. A person who is studying at a university or other place of higher education.
field.title: Student

field.help: An item written or printed in a diary, list, account book, or reference book.
field.title: Entry

group.title: Disputation
group.description:
Formal academic debate source: http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/disputation
In the scholastic system of education of the Middle Ages, disputations (in Latin: disputationes, singular: disputatio) offered a formalized method of debate designed to uncover and establish truths in theology and in sciences. Fixed rules governed the process: they demanded dependence on traditional written authorities and the thorough understanding of each argument on each side. source https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disputation
Also see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Praeses#Old_German_academic_use

field.help: A person or organization who makes an answer to the courts pursuant to an application for redress (usually in an equity proceeding) or a candidate for a degree who defends or opposes a thesis provided by the praeses in an academic disputation
field.title: Respondent

field.help: A person who is the faculty moderator of an academic disputation, normally proposing a thesis and participating in the ensuing disputation
field.title: Praeses

group.title: PersonalTestimony
group.description: A solemn written or oral statement as to the truth of a matter.

field.help: A person who gives a testimony, a solemn written or oral statement as to the truth of a matter.
field.title: Testifier

group.title: PromotionToDegree
group.description: The receiving or conferring of an academic degree.

field.help: The role of an agent that gives an award.
field.title: AwardingBody

field.help: A person who has successfully completed a course of study or training, especially a person who has been awarded an undergraduate or first academic degree.
field.title: Graduate

group.title: Study
group.description: The devotion of time and attention to acquiring knowledge on an academic subject, especially by means of books.

field.help: An organisation where the activity of imparting knowledge to or instructing (someone) as to how to do something is conducted.
field.title: TeachingInstitution

field.help: A person who is studying at a university or other place of higher education. A person who is studying at a university or other place of higher education.
field.title: Student

field.help: The role of a person who imparts knowledge to or instructs someone as to how to do something.
field.title: Teacher

group.title: Teaching
group.description: The activity of giving instruction, especially in an elementary or secondary school or a university.

field.help: An organisation where the activity of imparting knowledge to or instructing (someone) as to how to do something is conducted.
field.title: TeachingInstitution

field.help: A person who is studying at a university or other place of higher education. A person who is studying at a university or other place of higher education.
field.title: Student

field.help: The role of a person who imparts knowledge to or instructs someone as to how to do something.
field.title: Teacher

group.title: Trade
group.description: Trade is to transfer the ownership of goods from one person or entity to another by getting something in exchange from the buyer.

field.help: The role of a person who makes a purchase.
field.title: Buyer

field.help: The role of a person who sells something.
field.title: Seller

group.title: Contract
group.description: A written or spoken agreement, especially one concerning employment, sales, or tenancy, that is intended to be enforceable by law.

field.help: A party to a contract
field.title: Contractee

field.help: A document containing a written representation of a contract
field.title: ContractDocument

group.title: InclusionAlbumAmicorum
group.description: An activity where a personl includes a creative work in an Album Amicorum

field.help: The first true autograph books that appeared in German and Dutch linguistic regions (possibly originating in Wittenberg) by the mid-16th century. Known as an album amicorum ("book of friends") or stammbuch ("friendship book").http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autograph_book
field.title: AlbumAmicorum

field.help: A work that is a distinct intellectual or artistic creation and is the product of creative effort.
field.title: CreativeWork

field.help: A person or thing that contributes something, in particular.
field.title: Contributor

field.help: The role of a person who owns something, ie that someone or something belongs or relates to the person mentioned. The role of a person who owns something.
field.title: Owner

group.title: ExchangeOccasionalVerse
group.description: An activity where one person authors verse and sends it to another person.

field.help: Writing arranged with a metrical rhythm, typically having a rhyme.
field.title: Verse

field.help: The role of a person who sends something, especially a letter by post
field.title: Sender

field.help: The role of a person or thing that receives or is awarded something.
field.title: Recipient

group.title: Collaboration
group.description: Activity of working together to do a task and to achieve shared goals

field.help: The role of a person who works jointly on an activity or project; an associate.
field.title: Collaborator

group.title: Travel
group.description: The activity of making a journey, typically of some length.

field.help: A person who is travelling or who often travels.
field.title: Traveller

group.title: SocialVisit
group.description: The activity of going to see and spend time with (someone) socially

field.help: The role of a person visiting someone or somewhere, especially socially or as a tourist.
field.title: Visitor

field.help: The role of a person who receives or entertains other people as guests.
field.title: Host

group.title: Meeting
group.description: Activity when two or more people meet, by chance or arrangement

field.help: The role of a person who participates and is present at a conference or other gathering.
field.title: Attendee

group.title: Introduction
group.description: The context of one person being introduced to another person by way of a third person who acts as an intermediary.

field.help: The role of a person who acts as a link between people.
field.title: Intermediary

field.help: The role of a person who takes part in something
field.title: Participant

group.title: Acquaintanceship
group.description: The context in which two people know each other slightly, but who are not close friends

field.help: The role of a person one knows slightly, but who is not a close friend.
field.title: Acquaintance

group.title: Correspondence
group.description: an activity where one person writes a letter to another person.

field.help: The role of a person who writes letters on a regular basis.
field.title: Correspondent

field.help: A person that sends a letter
field.title: LetterSender

field.help: The role of a person or thing that receives a letter.
field.title: LetterRecipient

group.title: Friendship
group.description: a relationship of mutual affection between two or more people. Friendship is a stronger form of interpersonal bond than an association.

field.help: A person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection, typically one exclusive of sexual or family relations.
field.title: Friend

group.title: Ennoble
group.description: The activity of making someone a member of the nobility.

group.title: CreationActivity
group.description: Activity that brings something into existence.

field.help: A work that is a distinct intellectual or artistic creation and is the product of creative effort.
field.title: CreativeWork

field.help: The role of a person or thing that brings something into existence.
field.title: Creator

group.title: AuthoringActivity
group.description: Activity that involves the writing of a book, article or document.

field.help: A work that is a distinct intellectual or artistic creation and is the product of creative effort.
field.title: CreativeWork

field.help: A writer of a book, article, or document. The role of someone who writes a book, article, or document.
field.title: Author

group.title: ContributionActivity
group.description: Activity that involves the contiribution of something by a person or thing

field.help: A work that is a distinct intellectual or artistic creation and is the product of creative effort.
field.title: CreativeWork

field.help: A person or thing that contributes something, in particular.
field.title: Contributor

group.title: DedicationActivity
group.description: An activity that involves an address or inscription (of a literary work, for example) to another as a mark of respect or affection The activity of addressing or inscribing (a literary work, for example) to another as a mark of respect or affection.

field.help: The role of a person who dedicates something to someone or something
field.title: Dedicator

field.help: The role of an entity to whom something is dedicated
field.title: Dedicatee

field.help: A work that is a distinct intellectual or artistic creation and is the product of creative effort.
field.title: CreativeWork

field.help: Writing or carving (words or symbols) on something, especially as a formal or permanent record., as on a monument or in a book
field.title: Inscription

group.title: DedicationOfItem
group.description: To address or inscribe an item to another as a mark of respect or affection.

field.help: The role of a person who dedicates something to someone or something
field.title: Dedicator

field.help: The role of an entity to whom something is dedicated
field.title: Dedicatee

field.help: Writing or carving (words or symbols) on something, especially as a formal or permanent record., as on a monument or in a book
field.title: Inscription

group.title: DedicationOfWork
group.description: To address or inscribe a literary work to another as a mark of respect or affection.

field.help: The role of a person who dedicates something to someone or something
field.title: Dedicator

field.help: The role of an entity to whom something is dedicated
field.title: Dedicatee

field.help: A work that is a distinct intellectual or artistic creation and is the product of creative effort.
field.title: CreativeWork

field.help: Writing or carving (words or symbols) on something, especially as a formal or permanent record., as on a monument or in a book
field.title: Inscription

group.title: PrintingActivity
group.description: Activity that involves the production of books, newspapers or other printed materials.

field.help: A work that is a distinct intellectual or artistic creation and is the product of creative effort.
field.title: CreativeWork

group.title: PublishingActivity
group.description: The activity of preparing and issuing books, journals and other materials for sale.

field.help: A work that is a distinct intellectual or artistic creation and is the product of creative effort.
field.title: CreativeWork

group.title: Research
group.description: An activity involving the systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions.

field.help: The role of a person who undertakes a systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusion.
field.title: Researcher

group.title: Salon
group.description: A regular social gathering, especially of writers and artists

field.help: The role of a person who attends a salon (social gathering).
field.title: Saloniste

group.title: Employment
group.description: The activity of having paid work.

field.help: a person or organization that employs people.
field.title: Employer

field.help: a person employed for wages or salary, especially at non-executive level.
field.title: Employee

group.title: MembershipProfessionalBody
group.description: Membership of a person to a professional body

field.help: The role of an agent belonging to a particular group The role of a person, country, or organization that has joined a group, society, or team.
field.title: Member

field.help: A nonprofit formal organization seeking to further a particular profession, the interests of individuals engaged in that profession, and the public interest.
field.title: ProfessionalBody

group.title: DisqualificationFromOffice
group.description: Activity declaring (someone) ineligible for an office because of an offence or infringement

field.help: A position of authority or service, typically one of a public nature A post that is a position of authority or service, typically one of a public nature.

group.title: Baptism
group.description: The Christian religious rite of sprinkling water on to a personâ€™s forehead or of immersing them in water, symbolizing purification or regeneration and admission to the Christian Church. In many denominations, baptism is performed on young children and is accompanied by name-giving.

field.help: The role of a person who is admitted to membership of a Christian church.
field.title: BaptismalCandidate

field.help: The role of a person who presents a person at baptism and promises to take responsibility for their religious education.
field.title: Godparent

field.help: The role of a person who is presented at baptism by a godparent who promises to take responsibility for their religious education.
field.title: Godchild

field.help: The role of a person who performs a religious rite or presides over a religious service or ceremony.
field.title: Officiant

group.title: Ordination
group.description: The action of making (someone) a priest or minister; confer holy orders.

field.help: The role of a person who performs a religious rite or presides over a religious service or ceremony.
field.title: Officiant

group.title: Preach
group.description: Deliver a sermon or religious address to an assembled group of people, typically in church.

group.title: ReligiousConfirmation
group.description: Confirmation is a rite of initiation in several Christian denominations, normally carried out through anointing, the laying on of hands, and prayer, for the purpose of bestowing the Gift of the Holy Spirit.

field.help: The role of a person who performs a religious rite or presides over a religious service or ceremony.
field.title: Officiant

field.help: The role of a person who is confirmed during the religious rite or sacrament of confirmation
field.title: ConfirmationCandidate

group.title: ReligiousConversion
group.description:
The adoption, wholesale, of a set of beliefs identified with one particular religious denomination to the exclusion of others. Religious conversion marks a transformation of religious identity and is symbolized by special rituals.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_conversion

field.help: The role of a person who performs a religious rite or presides over a religious service or ceremony.
field.title: Officiant

group.title: ReligiousConfession
group.description: Confession is the acknowledgment of sin (or one's sinfulness) or wrongs. It is a religious practice in a number of faith traditions.

field.help: The role of a priest who hears confessions and gives absolution and spiritual counsel
field.title: Confessor

field.help: The role of a person who repents their sins and (in the Christian Church) seeks forgiveness from God.
field.title: Confessee

group.title: MembershipProfessionalBody
group.description: Membership of a person to a professional body

field.help: The role of an agent belonging to a particular group The role of a person, country, or organization that has joined a group, society, or team.
field.title: Member

field.help: A nonprofit formal organization seeking to further a particular profession, the interests of individuals engaged in that profession, and the public interest.
field.title: ProfessionalBody

field.help: A position of authority or service, typically one of a public nature A post that is a position of authority or service, typically one of a public nature.
field.title: Office

group.title: RepresentativeAssembly
group.description: A political institution in which a number of persons representing the population or privileged orders within the population of a state come together to debate, negotiate with the executive (originally the king or other ruler) and legislate.
